channel.title: Chapter 7 Notes on TheVue
channel.description: Recent content in Chapter 7 Notes on TheVue

item.title: Trigonometric Identities
item.description: Notes: Reciprocal identities: tan(x) = 1 / cot(x) sec(x) = 1 / cos(x) csc(x) = 1/ sin(x) tan(x) = sin(x) / cos(x) Cot(x) = cos(x) / sin(x) Pythagorean Identities: Sin2(x) + cos2(x) = 1 Tan2(x) + 1 = sec2(x) 1 + cot2(x) = csc2(x) Odd-Even Identities: sin(-x) = -sin(x) tan(-x) = -tan(x) cot(-x) = -cot(x)

item.title: Adding and Subtracting Identities
item.description: Notes: Addition and Subtraction identities Learn 6 new identities: cos(x + y) = cos(x) * cos(y) - sin(x) * sin(y) cos(x - y) = cos(x) * cos(y) + sin(x) * sin(y) sin(x + y) = sin(x) * cos(y) + cos(x) * sin(y) sin(x - y) = sin(x) * cos(y) - cos(x) * sin(y) tan(x + y) = tan(x) + tan(y) / 1 - (tan(x))(tan(y))

item.title: Double and Half angle Identities
item.description: Notes: Double angle and half angle identities Identities for Double angles Sin(2x) = sin(x + x) = sin(x) * cos(x) + cos(x) * sin(x) = 2sin(x)cos(x) vvv Cosine has 3 outputs vvv cos(2x) = cos(x + x) = cos(x) * cos(x) - sin(x) * sin(x) = cos2(x) - sin2(x) && (1 - sin2(x)) - sin2(x) = 1 - 2sin2(x) && Cos2(x) - (1 - cos2(x)) = 2cos2(x) - 1

item.title: Trigonometric Inverse Functions
item.description: Notes: Remember inverse functions? Inverse functions are one-to-one functions: f(x) and g(x) such that… f(g(x)) = x and g(f(x)) = x Remember which functions had inverse functions? Only one-to-one functions have inverse functions. Remember that these are functions that pass the horizontal line test. To define the inverse function of f(x) = sin(x), we pretty clear have a problem… The function fails the horizontal line test spectacularly!
